byline.contributor: Owen Robinson reported from Charlottesville, and Sheryl Gay Stolberg from Washington.
byline.original: By OWEN ROBINSON  and SHERYL GAY STOLBERG

abstract: Charlottesville, Va, Police Chief Timothy J Longo Sr says at news conference that investigation into gang rape at University of Virginia fraternity, described in Rolling Stone magazine, has found no evidence to corroborate that event occurred; says investigation is suspended, but not closed; lack of evidence is latest unraveling of story, which shook university and prompted changes to way it approached sexual assault, even as it raised concerns in realms of journalism and advocacy of sexual assault victims.
lead_paragraph: The announcement came four months after a now-discredited report in Rolling Stone magazine of a gang rape at a fraternity rocked the campus.

headline.main: Police Find No Evidence of Rape at University of Virginia Fraternity
headline.print_headline: Story of Rape Keeps Falling Apart

snippet: The announcement came four months after a now-discredited report in Rolling Stone magazine of a gang rape at a fraternity rocked the campus.
